channel.title: [POLL] Easiest language to learn? Besides Java [POLL]
channel.description: I pretty much know java like the back of my hand now so i'm looking for anothing easy one to learn, any suggestions?

item.title: [POLL] Easiest language to learn? Besides Java [POLL]
item.dc:creator: @HoMM HoMM
item.description:
@HoMM wrote:

Well I would say that if you consider scar as a programming language then consider Game Maker (with GML) as a language too? www.gamemaker.nl
It is really easy tool to make games and programms and is based on pascal too…
Anyway, firstly GML, lol, and considering only the real languages, then firstly BASIC and then PASCAL.

item.source: [POLL] Easiest language to learn? Besides Java [POLL]

item.title: [POLL] Easiest language to learn? Besides Java [POLL]
item.dc:creator: @googlethis googlethis
item.description:
@googlethis wrote:

[quote=“ada, post:24, topic:16710”][quote author=Iamadam link=topic=24965.msg322445#msg322445 date=1161019045]
Stick to java. Trust me, you can never know it all.
Once you know the basics of a language you have to play around with it and develop programming techniques. There’s no point in learning a language to a basic level then moving on - rather learn one and master it.

And if you really want to learn anything else, do C++. It’s pretty handy.
[/quote]

I agree with this statement[/quote]
I don’t agree. Learning a simpler language first helps. But I do agree that C++ and Java are awesome languages.

Read full topic
item.source: [POLL] Easiest language to learn? Besides Java [POLL]

Once you know the basics of a language you have to play around with it and develop programming techniques. There’s no point in learning a language to a basic level then moving on - rather learn one and master it.

And if you really want to learn anything else, do C++. It’s pretty handy.[/quote]

I agree with this statement

item.source: [POLL] Easiest language to learn? Besides Java [POLL]

item.title: [POLL] Easiest language to learn? Besides Java [POLL]
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Stick to java. Trust me, you can never know it all.
Once you know the basics of a language you have to play around with it and develop programming techniques. There’s no point in learning a language to a basic level then moving on - rather learn one and master it.

And if you really want to learn anything else, do C++. It’s pretty handy.

Read full topic

item.source: [POLL] Easiest language to learn? Besides Java [POLL]

item.title: [POLL] Easiest language to learn? Besides Java [POLL]
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:13, topic:16710”]Scar really isn’t a language, it’s a pascal scripting based interpreter… So you don’t code it, you script it…
Technically you can’t call it pascal either…[/quote]

Either way it gives you a good idea of what to expect when you start real programming.

Read full topic

php is imho easy
[/quote]Well, with that you have to worry about MySql too which is ‘scaring’ me off from Php.

Since when did anyone think Java was the easiest? [/quote]
You can use flat files, you don’t have to use MySql

And uh HTML isn’t a programming language…
